title: I don‚Äôt support slavery rideshare business model
text: Lyft and Uber seazed the taxi and rideshare market for themselves, while their drivers struggling to get the minimum wage.Uber charge us( Riders) about $1  a minute and more so its about $60 an hour, but they give our drivers (who take care of our rides, safety and service us as queens and kings ) less than $20 an houre. So I decided to not pay lyft and after I order the trip and get the driver close to me I cancel the trip with lyft and pay directly the driver who accept always my offere of 5% 10% and 20% less than of Uber prices. Uber needs to respect drivers to guarantee our safety not getting into very ungry drivers‚Äô cars who is really treated badly by Uber.

title: Worst customer service
text: I actually was unable to even book a ride with Uber. My first attempt it flagged my account, and now it is useless. I am not allowed to pay with a credit card. I am not allowed to pay through Venmo. It will not let me even load gift cards even though one of the chat customer service people told me I could absolutely do that until I could. That misinformation cost me $100 that I will never get back. And all of the customer service is done through chat. There is not anybody to call and talk to. No live breathing person. So don‚Äôt download the app. Don‚Äôt even use the service, because if you have a problem, they cannot will not, and are unable to fix it. And nor can they tell you why your account is flagged when it will be on flagged and how you can challenge it. The worst business model ever.
